docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Friday, Sept. 1 -- Brazilian troops and ships were on the move today to put down forces supporting Vice President Joao Goulart in the dispute over the Brazilian Presidency.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Friday, Sept. 1 -- Brazilian troops and ships were on the move today to put down forces supporting Vice President Joao Goulart in the dispute over the Brazilian Presidency.
docs.abstract: Mil forces reptd moving to put down pro-Goulart forces; govs of several states urge peaceful solution; Cong, 298-14, tentatively approves plan for parliamentary govt with weak Pres and strong Premier; some mil leaders back plan; unrest described; map

headline.main: BRAZILIAN UNITS REPORTED ASHORE IN 'REBEL' AREAS; Naval Forces Act to Crush Military Support in South for Vice President Brazil's Units Reported Landing In the South to Crush 'Rebellion'

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: TEL AVIV, Israel, Sept. 1 (UPI) -- Ron Barak of Los Angeles, the lone American gymnast at the Maccabiah games, won four gold medals today.
docs.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV, Israel, Sept. 1 (UPI) -- Ron Barak of Los Angeles, the lone American gymnast at the Maccabiah games, won four gold medals today.

docs.snippet: From the coffee port of Santos last week, Janio Quadros -- Brazil's President until his sudden resignation ten days ago -- quietly embarked on the S.S. Uruguay-Star for London. At airports in Paris, New York, Panama City, Lima, Buenos Aires and...
docs.lead_paragraph: From the coffee port of Santos last week, Janio Quadros -- Brazil's President until his sudden resignation ten days ago -- quietly embarked on the S.S. Uruguay-Star for London. At airports in Paris, New York, Panama City, Lima, Buenos Aires and Montevideo during the week, Dr. Quadros' would-be successor, Vice President Joao Belchoir ("Jango") Goulart, conferred anxiously by telephone with his supporters at home, as he made his way back to Brazil.

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was quiet and uneventful during the past week. British pound sterling continued its upward movement while the Canadian dollar showed a firmer undertone.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange market was quiet and uneventful during the past week. British pound sterling continued its upward movement while the Canadian dollar showed a firmer undertone.

docs.snippet: TEL AVIV Israel, Sept. 3 (UPI) -- Dick Savitt and Mike Franks reached the men's singles final in tennis. Savitt, the former Wimbledon champion, scored a 6 -- 2, 6 -- 4, 6 -- 4 victory over Rod Mandelstam of South Africa. Franks defeated Julie Mayers...
docs.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV Israel, Sept. 3 (UPI) -- Dick Savitt and Mike Franks reached the men's singles final in tennis. Savitt, the former Wimbledon champion, scored a 6 -- 2, 6 -- 4, 6 -- 4 victory over Rod Mandelstam of South Africa. Franks defeated Julie Mayers of South Africa, 6 -- 8, 6 -- 1, 6 -- 2, 8 -- 6.

headline.main: Medical Parley in Rio Is Set

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- The United States, Panama, Colombia and Ecuador were named today as members of a special inter-American investigating commission that to leave for the Dominican Republic next Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 -- The United States, Panama, Colombia and Ecuador were named today as members of a special inter-American investigating commission that to leave for the Dominican Republic next Tuesday.
docs.abstract: US, Panama, Colombia and Ecuador named to OAS com

docs.snippet: The strong upward movement of the British pound sterling featured the foreign exchange market last week. Trading was heavy. Canadian dollar maintained a very firm undertone on light dealings.

docs.snippet: MILFORD, Conn., Sept. 12 -- Thomas G. Allen of Buffalo triumphed in the opening race of the first International Lightning Class Association world sailing championship on Long Island Sound today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MILFORD, Conn., Sept. 12 -- Thomas G. Allen of Buffalo triumphed in the opening race of the first International Lightning Class Association world sailing championship on Long Island Sound today.
